action.action-desc: Mr. Barrett introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to increase the vehicle length limitation for truck tractor-lowboy trailer combinations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lowboy Auto Hauler Fairness Act of 2025.
Section 31111 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) by adding at the end the following:
The term lowboy trailer means a semitrailer with a depressed section between the hitch and the first rear axle that is used specifically for the transport of assembled highway vehicles.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (H), by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

imposes a vehicle length limitation of less than 80 feet on a truck tractor-lowboy trailer combination with a front overhang of less than 4 feet between the rear of the truck-tractor and the front of the lowboy trailer and a rear overhang of less than 6 feet, regardless of whether the truck-tractor is or is not capable of carrying cargo for the lowboy trailer to use the front and rear overhang.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Lowboy trailers shall be exempt from the rear overhang flag requirements of section 393.87 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations.
